abstracts.cdata!:
The Request for Inspection of the Jamuna
            Bridge Project in Bangladesh states that the Bank has
            violated its own policies and procedures regarding this
            project. The Requesters, the Jamuna Char Integrated
            Development Project (JCDP), give a history of the Jamuna
            Bridge Project and express concern over the construction of
            the bridge, which will require the resettlement of more
            people than originally thought.  The people that live on the
            char, or small islands in the Jamuna River, will need to be
            resettled as a result of the bridge construction, but their
            resettlement was not included in the original plan. The
            Requesters state that the Bank's policy disallows
            involuntary resettlement, but the potential threat of
            displacement to the char people has not been taken into
            account. Major concerns involve guide bunds that would cause
            the river levels to rise and flood the char people's
            land and homes. The Requesters note that most of the people
            that would be affected only heard about the construction of
            the Jamuna bridge through hear-say. While there have been
            plans to resettle people, the land designated for the
            resettlement  can only accommodate approximately 20 percent
            of the people that will need land as a result of the
            construction.  The JCDP states that agriculture, social
            connections and livelihood would be destroyed by the
            resettlement and destruction of the char lands.
